other_tests.findings: Identification of a c.3019_3020del variant in exon 15 of the PCNT gene, predicted to lead to a premature codon termination.

Multiple bone anomalies including bone age delay (1 year and 3 months at a chronological age of 3 years and 10 months), dislocation of the humeral ossification center, convex shape of the radius bilaterally, and bilateral subluxation of the femoral heads.

Areas of gliosis with encephalomalacia, diffuse hypo/delayed myelination, irregularity of the subependymal surface, thinned corpus callosum, dilation of the lateral ventricles, thinned appearance of the middle and anterior cerebral arteries, and trigonocephaly.

Multiple aneurysms in various cerebral arteries, occlusion of the M1 segment of both middle cerebral arteries, and irregular and stenotic appearance of the A3-A4 segments of the anterior cerebral arteries associated with Moyamoya disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progression noted with the development of multiple aneurysms and occlusion.
